faq.title: FAQ
faq.q1.question: How are savings calculated?
faq.q1.answer: We use compound interest. Each month we add your monthly contribution to the current balance, then apply a monthly rate derived from the annual expected return. The final balance is the sum of the growth on the starting amount and all monthly contributions.
faq.q2.question: What does Expected Return mean?
faq.q2.answer: Expected Return is the annual percentage growth you anticipate. We convert it to a monthly rate by dividing by 12 and apply it each month.
faq.q3.question: Is the calculation adjusted for inflation?
faq.q3.answer: No. The calculator shows nominal growth. To account for inflation, you can reduce the expected return by your estimated inflation rate.
faq.q4.question: Can I model irregular contributions?
faq.q4.answer: Not yet. The current version assumes a fixed monthly contribution. We plan to add variable contributions in a future update.
faq.q5.question: Why do the monthly totals look slightly different from the final total?
faq.q5.answer: Monthly rows are rounded for display. The final total uses the full compound formula, so small rounding differences can appear.
faq.footer: Have more questions? We'll keep expanding this list as the calculator grows.
